intro: Pyrus malus var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth apple, is a variety of the domestic apple tree characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark. It is a deciduous tree that produces fruits with a firm, crisp texture and a sweet to tart flavor. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has alternate, simple, ovate leaves with a serrated margin. It thrives in temperate climates and is cultivated for both its ornamental value and edible fruit. The flowers are white and appear in clusters, followed by the development of the characteristic apple fruits.
